Nemanja Blagojevic

Web Developer, Programmer & Designer

BIO

I have started learning web development out of curiosity and realized that I want to live out of it. Currently, I am working on landing a first developer job and simultaneously expanding my skills to become full-stack JavaScript developer. And after that? Well there's a bunch of programming languages and I want to learn them all! C#, you better take care!

My teachers

Youtube, Udemy, coding sites and more

Internet is such a wondeful place. It provided me with bunch of resources for personal development. My favorite teacher is the most definitely Bucky Roberts (thenewboston.com)! Unfortunately he is not publishing new tutorials but his youtube channel is still great for learning core concepts of some new technology. Brad Traversy and Maximilian Schwarzm√ºller are teachers from Udemy that helped me with their projects to understand the whole web development process. When I started to learn web development my first step was made in Codecademy and after that freeCodeCamp and Team Treehouse. These platforms have given me solution to my problems with understanding a theory. Currently fixing problems now is much easier for me because I prefer to read documentation of a technology I'm using or check documentation on W3Schools/MDN for HTML/CSS/JS.

My Skills

Hey Nemanja, What do you know?

HTML, CSS and JavaScript! Well it's not just that. I am familiar with Jade, but I prefer plain HTML. With CSS is totally different story! I love Sass/Less ! They help me to style my site much faster and to experiment easily with custom color themes. Also, I adore CSS frameworks, Bootstrap and Materialize especially, but I have a grasp of Bulma, Foundation and Skeleton. Vanilla JavaScript and jQuery are great, but lately I've been using TypeScript due to working on Angular apps. For installing packages I prefer npm, but I could also use bower and yarn. Taskrunner of my choice is gulp.js with plug-ins for minification, concatination or image optimization.
Development can be really a painful experience if you don't have a clear picture of what you're doing. For creating vision of my site I use Figma.

Future development

IT Academy - Microsoft software developer

I have enrolled in IT Academy - Microsoft development course that starts in November. Goal of this course is to get comfortable with writing web and desktop applications. In year to come I will be working on gaining knowledge in C#(ASP.Net MVC and all prerequisites), SQL programming and administration, software engineering etc.

Aloeveraflp.rs is the first site I built and really needs update. I am currently working on conversation of that static site in full-operational web application. Therefore my plan is to complete my Angular knowledge and to gain firm knowledge in MongoDB/Mongoose and Node/Express.js
